page.title: 01GREAT LUMLEY - ENVIRONS.
page.content: Mainly east of the Wear,our block is a predominantly rural area including the extensive woods and parkland of Lumley Castle, the fringes of Lambton Estate and the settlements of Great Lumley, Woodstone and Bournmoor. Our survey concentrates on Great Lumley,as being typical of the area and its life.Great Lumley is a compact, dormitory village of varied amenities,with a farming and mining past. Eastwards, we find the mainly residential settlements of Woodstone and Bournmoor with pockets of industry, a brickworks and solid fuel plant. Lumley's written history predates 1066, going back to the times of the Saxon Lord Liulph. The village itself commands a magnificent panorama westwards over the broad Wear Valley to the lower slopes of the Pennines, and northwards to industrial Tyneside. {M.Smith.
